creator: opensource@kanshi.fr
text:
Version 2.13 r1665067

Hello,

I'm trying to run JMeter in Distributed mode, but the master cannot connect to the slave if the slave doesn't listen on port 1099:

Slave:
/home/jmeter/bin/jmeter-server -Dserver.rmi.localport=10100 -n -Jsearch_paths=/loadtest/jar/ -t=/loadtest/tests/upload.jmx -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=172.17.0.3
Using local port: 10100
Created remote object: UnicastServerRef [liveRef: [endpoint:[172.17.0.3:10100](local),objID:[510fa22f:1518c978353:-7fff, -928921409570465420]]]


Master:
/home/jmeter/bin/jmeter.sh -n -R172.17.0.3:10100 -t=/loadtest/tests/upload.jmx -Jsearch_paths=/loadtest/jar/
Creating summariser <summary>
Created the tree successfully using /loadtest/tests/upload.jmx
Configuring remote engine: 172.17.0.3:10100
no such object in table
Failed to configure 172.17.0.3:10100
Stopping remote engines
Remote engines have been stopped
Error in NonGUIDriver java.lang.RuntimeException: Following remote engines could not be configured:[172.17.0.3:10100]


==================================

Listening on 1099:
Slave:
/home/jmeter/bin/jmeter-server -Dserver.rmi.localport=1099 -n -Jsearch_paths=/loadtest/jar/ -t=/loadtest/tests/upload.jmx -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=172.17.0.3
Using local port: 1099
Created remote object: UnicastServerRef [liveRef: [endpoint:[172.17.0.3:1099](local),objID:[-95a2b0d:1518c980448:-7fff, -1440560730007513306]]]
Starting the test on host 172.17.0.3:1099 @ Thu Dec 10 15:52:38 UTC 2015 (1449762758180)
INFO :: Starting Upload Test


Master:
/home/jmeter/bin/jmeter.sh -n -R172.17.0.3:1099 -t=/loadtest/tests/upload.jmx -Jsearch_paths=/loadtest/jar/
Creating summariser <summary>
Created the tree successfully using /loadtest/tests/upload.jmx
Configuring remote engine: 172.17.0.3:1099
Starting remote engines
Starting the test @ Thu Dec 10 15:52:37 UTC 2015 (1449762757802)
Remote engines have been started


Thanks for you help,
Best regards

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Bugzilla is not a support forum.

Please subscribe to the JMeter user list and ask there.
But please first check the archives as this question has been asked before.

creator: opensource@kanshi.fr
text:
Hello,

You are right. I got confused with the documentation's instruction as in the log the port number didn't seem to be in sync with the command line. But I know understood the difference between RMI & Server.

SERVER_PORT=10100 /home/jmeter/bin/jmeter-server -n -Jsearch_paths=/loadtest/jar/ -t=/loadtest/tests/upload.jmx

Created remote object: UnicastServerRef [liveRef: [endpoint:[10.0.0.6:55245](local),objID:[-4246995e:1519075179e:-7fff, -914146473078265111]]]

Thank you,
Best regards
